title: 112_s845
content:
The Tax Return Due Date Simplification and Modernization Act of 2011 establishes new due dates for partnership Form 1065, S Corporation Form 1120S, and C Corporation Form 1120. The Tax Return Due Date Simplification and Modernization Act of 2011 sets new due dates for partnership and S Corporation tax returns. Partnerships must file by March 15 for calendar year basis and S Corporations under sections 6012 and 6037 must also adhere to new filing deadlines. The Tax Return Due Date Simplification and Modernization Act of 2011 establishes new filing deadlines for partnership and S Corporation tax returns. Returns based on the calendar year must be filed by March 31, while those based on a fiscal year are due by the last day of the third month following the close of the fiscal year. Amendments have been made to sections 1362(b) and 1362(d)(1)(C) to reflect these changes. Amendments have been made to various sections, including 1362(d)(1)(C)(ii), to change the deadline from the 15th day to the last day of the 3rd month. Additionally, other sections such as 170(a)(2)(B) and 563 have been amended to change the deadline from the third month to the 4th month. Amendments have changed deadlines from the 15th day to the last day of the 3rd month in various sections. Section 6655 is amended to change the deadline from the 3rd month to the 4th month for returns after December 31, 2011. Modification of due dates by regulation. The Secretary of the Treasury will modify regulations for tax return extensions:
- Partnerships filing Form 1065 get a 6-month extension until September 15.
- Trusts filing Form 1041 get a 5.5-month extension until September 30.
- Employee benefit plans filing Form 5500 get a 3.5-month extension until November 15.
- Tax-exempt organizations filing Form 990 get a 6-month extension until November 15. The due dates for certain tax forms for calendar year filers are as follows:
- Form 3520-A is due on April 15 with a 6-month extension until October 15.
- Form TD F 90-22.1 is due on April 15 with a 6-month extension until October 15. Section 4 allows corporations to automatically extend their income tax returns from 3 months to 6 months. This amendment applies to returns for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
